markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Harmonize](/Feats.aspx?ID=193) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Bard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=19" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Metamagic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=107" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 101 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[maestro muse](/Muses.aspx?ID=2)

</column>

---

You can perform multiple compositions simultaneously. If your next action is to cast a composition, it becomes a harmonized composition. Unlike a normal composition, a harmonized composition doesn’t end if you cast another composition, and you can cast another composition on the same turn as a harmonized one. Casting another harmonized composition ends any harmonized composition you have in effect.

<title level="2">Harmonize leads to...</title>
[Symphony of the Muses](/Feats.aspx?ID=213)
name: Harmonize
